intro: Whytockia gongshanensis, commonly known as the Gongshan whytockia, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in mountainous regions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a rough texture, while its stems are erect and somewhat woody. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
